poem:
**Changing of the Guard**

In the quiet corridors of power,
Shigeru Ishiba steps lightly,
his moderate heart a shoreline
cradled by the tumult of tides.
Beside him, history whispers—
a woman's almost-victory
glimmering like morning mist.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Japan’s ruling party picks Shigeru Ishiba to become next PM Shigeru Ishiba, a veteran moderate, will next week be installed as Japan’s prime minister after he was elected leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party (LDP). The 67-year-old, a former defence minister, beat his rightwing rival Sanae Takaichi, who was attempting to become the country’s first female prime minister, by 215 votes to 194 in a runoff election at the LDP headquarters in Tokyo on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Japan’s ruling party picks Shigeru Ishiba to become next PM Shigeru Ishiba, a veteran moderate, will next week be installed as Japan’s prime minister after he was elected leader of the governing Liberal Democratic party (LDP).
